Key Match Events: England won by 4 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: England have won their last seven T20Is against Sri Lanka
Sri Lanka have not beaten England since 2014
Sam Curran has nine wickets, with an economy rate of 6.28
Mark Wood, the fastest bowler of this World Cup so far, has six wickets
Adil Rashid has nine wickets, and an economy rate of 5.91 against Sri Lanka
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface will be worn - two matches having been played on it already
This should suit the spinners, of whom Sri Lanka have a superior contingent
Of the bowlers who didn't play the first round, only Anrich Nortje has more wickets (10) than Curran's nine
Wanindu Hasaranga, who's got 13 from the seven games he's played, was the last World Cup's top wicket-taker
Others: England's net run rate is well clear of Australia's
All they need to do is win, by any margin
Sri Lanka may go with the same XI that beat Afghanistan
England are likely to retain the side that beat New Zealand
